Because eclipse 3.1 was started with jdk 1.4.2, files with a path longer than 256 chars could not be created. works with jdk 1.5.

This issue sounds worthy of some better documentation, "readme", or FAQ. 
I wonder too if its ALL 1.4.2 JRE's? Anyone know right off?

If this is a problem with all 1.4.2 JREs as suggested, I agree that this needs some readme/FAQ item.

Simon, would you care to draft a sample blurb that explains this problem? Once I have a blurb and confirmation of the problem I can post the blurb to the FAQ and see about including it in WTP's official documentation.

The problem seems to be even worse: the deploy ANT scripts of a generic server will not work (because of long file names) once the default JRE from the workbench is not 1.5 (but 1.4.2).

I am opening this again as bug because if Eclipse is started with JRE 5 this JRE should also be used to launch ANT (and not simple the workspace default).

Correction: The JRE used for the execution of a generic server deploy script is actually the one configured for that server. As a consequence the deployment of resources with a path lenght longer the 256 chars will only work if the server was started with JRE 5.

Transferring to Gorkem since this is the path used by the generic servers. If there is anything that can be done by the server framework (provide an error message that lists path length as a possible reason for the failure?) please pass back or open a bug for me.
